intro: Cnidoscolus byssinus, commonly known as the horse radish plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to tropical regions of the Americas. It features large, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive velvety texture and a strong, pungent odor. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into spiny, woody fruits containing toxic seeds.
